Reviews.Title: “Summer all year.”
Reviews.Author: Siul70
Reviews.Content: Good location in the center of El Poblado de Boqueron is like the Rio Carnaval on the weekends. Good Seafood & Mojitos.

Reviews.Title: “Not coming back”
Reviews.Author: Jvazquez53
Reviews.Content: Hard to get a reservation, small rooms , outdated. The bathroom is so small that two people cannot fit at the same time. The only good thing is that is centrally located in the town of Boqueron, all the entertaiment is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “When something is to good to be true its because its not"”
Reviews.Author: Joannsosa
Reviews.Content: Staff was very nice, we were going to stay at a second flor they gave us a bucket and told us to come to the counter and they would suply us with ice, a control and a key they told us to plug the mini refridgerater when we got in, it was more like a bad motel, the room was filled with mosquitos,the bathrooms smelled liked something had died, the beds were hard as were the little pillows the quilt gave a itch that was terrible, the A/c was not working properly it made a racket, you could here children runing around like it was a play ground for at least 20-25 minutes till we called, and the Staff stoped them, the view from the balcony had all the streets wires hanging so near, that it felt very unconfortable and un safe, the lamp by the bedside had no bulb If your looking to get drunk and crash we got it cheap in Guztaso but if your planing a romantic getaway dont do it the rooms have 1 actual metal key with the room number if you get to park your car in the small space they give you a paper to place in the wind shield with your room number and name, like i said if your drunk none of this will bother you to top of the island had two earthquakes so we just picked up our stuf and there remote that we had to leave at the counter and left while the staff tried to reashure us that the tremor was felt in the whole Island we said thanks but that we had to leave, I'm sorry but this place needs to fix this it doesnt have an elevater had i noticed just a big slide like for wheel chairs we didnt get to enjoy Boqueron everything was just not in our favor=[ a really bad night!

Reviews.Title: “Nasty hotel”
Reviews.Author: lababy2428
Reviews.Content: Very dirty, nasty rooms and horrible services... I will never recomended this dump hotel

Reviews.Title: “We will be coming back in October God willing”
Reviews.Author: LewisPR
Reviews.Content: The last time i came here with my wife and kids was in 1994 and we had a wonderful time. Now, 17 years later I stayed here with my wife and it was not any different from our stayed in 1994. The service staff was outstanding, very helpful and courtious, the facilities were great, our room was in "mint condition" very clean, and spacious, very comfortable. Was very clean all around. The hotel restaurant "Las Cascadas" was outstanding, meals were great and so the attending staff. We are planning to coming back this October. We had a great time. Anyone who wants to rest, eat good, feel like home, "This is the place"

Reviews.Title: “Mosquito infested!”
Reviews.Author: MiriamL05
Reviews.Content: I checked in with my mother and two children... to this dreary dark, mosquito infested over priced inn. From the time I packed and carried my luggage down the stairs my daughter and I were biten over 15 times by mosquitos! Thank goodness grandma had allergy pills to calm the reaction to all the mosquito bites we received. I truely do not recommend this inn to families with children!

Reviews.Title: “A PERFECT GETAWAY WITH FAMILY!”
Reviews.Author: HurraKane
Reviews.Content: My family & I arrived at the hotel late at night. There was a friendly receptionist available to check us in. We went to our room tired, notice how spacious and clean it was kept. We recieved a room that overlooked Boqueron Beach! We loved waking up each morning and looking out to see the beautiful view. The mornings we went to the hotels resturant "La Cascada" means waterfall and there is one! We enjoyed a great breakfast that filled us up for the days adventures. There are nice local shops that are open on the weekends, bars and resturants, bodagas to shop and eat, and Boqueron Beach right near the hotel. We also went to Buye Beach, Combate Beach, Playa Sucia Beach (Cabo Rojo Lighthouse). All these beaches are different and beautiful in there own way! We never wanted to leave! For the first time, We took our 17m old baby boy to the Mayaguez Zoo to see the animals. He had a Blast! There's also a visitor's guide set up in the main lobby. If we had questions on how to get somewhere or just needed more information. The receptionist at the hotel was always available to answer our questions and give us more information. Our vacation unfortunately came to an end, I knew I would miss this beautiful sunny weather and go back home to cold snowy weather in NY. I will definently be returning to Puerto Rico and staying at Parador Boquemar, the whole staff was very friendly and willing to help my family and I at anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this Dump, or learn the hard way !”
Reviews.Author: lovepuertorico20
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel , it's a short stay motel for the local drunks. After I looked at the room with the towels with holes in them and beds that felt like they where plywood boards, I turned around and checked out. There are three irons for the entire motel. So if you plan to wear unwrinkled clothes you better bring your own, that includes the iron board. As for parking there is none available the locals use it because theres no one to tell them they cant. All in all it is an over rated dump ! I wonder who put their web sight together??

Reviews.Title: “No frills”
Reviews.Author: Cincy_Adventurer
Reviews.Content: Parador Boquemar fit my needs. I was looking for an fairly inexpensive, "no frills" place to spend one night. The room was adequate, although the pillows were flat and the bed was a bit uncomfortable. The staff was courteous. Parking was free. The location was great, as the hotel is on the main street in Boqueron. And, it was a short walk to the beach, nightlife, restaurants and souvenir shops.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: traviesa694
Reviews.Content: The only good thing is that is located in "El Poblado" that is very cool to spend the night, and that is near the beaches of Cabo Rojo. But the room was terrible, there was no hot water, the A/C did not worked properly and the bed was super uncomfortable, to top of the line is that the pool is small and no Wi-Fi! . There are better places to stay in Cabo Rojo.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my aching back!”
Reviews.Author: JulieAlicea
Reviews.Content: I found this little hotel to be quite clean and centrally located but my room was very simple and had the worst bed i have ever slept in. I felt like the princess with the pea under my mattress. I did not sleep a wink becaus my back and body hurt so badly. the next day i had to drive without any sleep, it was scary. In all fairness to the staff, they were very nice and accomodating, even let us leave 2 days in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Local Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rj_traveler_58
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Parador Boqueron July 31-Aug 3. The hotel was completely full, local tourism season. The entire little town of Boqueron was packed for the weekend. Lots of music, parties, etc. The hotel was full of families, seemed great for children, etc. The hotel is right on the main street for all the bars and restaurants, so it is really a rocking place outside well into the late hours. It makes it a little hard to sleep at first if you are note used to the energy of the island!! :-) We used the air conditioner unit in the room to drown out most of the noise. The rooms were smaller than most are used to, a more European-style room. The restaurant was incredible!! We ate there all nights because it was so good! Local Puerto Rican foods. Ummm !! The staff was super! The real warmth of the local people we are used to experiencing on the island. A great atmosphere for the hotel! All so nice to us. We will definitely return, but with the proper expectations... it is not a high-end comfort/luxury hotel!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Parador Boquemar”
Reviews.Author: malastare
Reviews.Content: Went over to Boqueron for a quick one-night stay and found this nice hotel just a few minutes from the beach. The staff was friendly and the price ($70 including taxes) was great. We had a 2-bed room (1 full bed, 1 twin), which was clean and included a fridge. It maybe needed a little paint but otherwise very nice. The general areas of the hotel were nice. There is a medium swimming pool and a restaurant with a lounge. Restaurant prices are reasonable, and the food is very good. The staff was friendly and attentive.The Boqueron town is within walking distance as well as the beach. Overall a very nice stay in the southwestern tip of Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Some photos for you”
Reviews.Author: LauraVioleta
Reviews.Content: I'm puertorican, live in San Juan. Just retired. Love BoquerÃ³n beach and the simple atmosphere at the poblado (fishing village). Go there about three times a year. Parador Boquemar is one of the nearest hotels to the beach, we've been there three times and stayed in other hotels in the area also. While San Juan has high season prices in winter, at that time in BoquerÃ³n you can find low summer prices because puertoricans do not prefer going to the beach in winter (except during holidays). If you dont like noise go during the weekdays and not on holidays and ask for a not noisy area of the hotel. Rooms facing the town and pool are noisier in my opinion. The beds must have been updated because i found no problem, no plastic cover or anything. True, two towels, but if you ask you'd be given hand towels and rug towel. Most people understand a little English. The hotel has a website. Employees are helpful. No elevator, maybe you can ask somebody to bring your luggage up. The stairs are wide and easy. The hotel's restaurant has a decorative water cascade because puerto rico is very hot in summer. It's nice to have breakfast there. Dinner is ok. There are other eateries and hotels around. Hope the photos help you. It's a simple but nice hotel. This is not the place to talk about the poblado itself which could take a lot of upkeep. But the beach you'd like.

Reviews.Title: “Up All Night”
Reviews.Author: jonco
Reviews.Content: Travelers looking for a place to sleep in Boqueron should think twice. (By the way Boqueron is nowhere near Ponce.) The main problem here is noise. On a quiet night, it might be ok, but tiny Boqueron is party central. The hotel is a stone's throw from the main drag. On the side facing the main street (Calle Jose de Diego), you will hear music blasted out by competing sound systems til at least 2am. On the other side, it's actually worse, because of an endless line of cars that drive by as long as the party keeps going. The hotel's windows have no glass, just screens and thin metal shutters, so you really hear the street noise, car alarms, voices, booming car stereos, engines gunning, etc. Neither the sound of the AC nor a set of earplugs had any chance against the level of noise here. We had the misfortune of being there on a holiday recently (Dia de Reyes, Jan. 5), and the party went on until sunrise. Apparently this is how it is in Boqueron on weekends and holidays, including many holidays that are obscure to non-Latin Americans. The night clerk was kind and helped us move to a slightly quieter room at 2:45am (the music stopped around 2, but resumed at 5:45am), but the day clerk, when asked why no one warned us that Dia de Reyes would mean an all-night party (even when I specified on the phone that we wanted a quiet room) replied that it is only the hotel's responsibility to inform clients of what facilities they offer, not to tell people about things going on outside the hotel. Thanks a lot. As for the facilities, they are pretty rustic for over $100 a night (no breakfast included). The pool is not heated; the TV gets about 8 low-rent cable channels, and the rooms, though spacious and acceptably clean, are very plain. When we arrived, our room had only two towels, though we asked for and got washcloths and a floor towel. The restaurant in the hotel is the nicest place in town, though nothing outstanding. It's too far to walk to the nearest beach. The only reason to consider this place at all is the lack of good alternatives in the Cabo Rojo area, which does have some nice beaches. We also stayed one night at the Bahia Salinas, which cost a good deal more, but was much nicer and certainly quieter (that wouldn't be hard). If you can afford that, it's a better option. We will not return to the Boquemar.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the service hated the beds”
Reviews.Author: rod3367
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parador Boquemar on July 19th through July 21st 2006 during my recent visit to Puerto Rico. The hotel came recommended through my Uncle and since we just walked in to inquire about vacancies I thought I would give it a try. The staff was very accommodating and very, very friendly but the beds in the rooms were like sleeping on bricks. I couldn't sleep comfortably my whole entire stay. Even though there was a storm and the power went out the Hotel was on backup generator which was plus. The beach is within walking distance and the place is somewhat centrally located. I would definitely want to stay there again if they replaced those brick beds. Let's just say my chiropractor wasn't too happy when I got back home to New Jersey.

Reviews.Title: “loved the parador boquemar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the parador boquemar during the 2006 christmas holiday, while at the parador service and the food at the restaurant was excellent, the beach is within walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Pesimo parador”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As many people that likes to do internal tourism in my island, I like to stay in hotels and inns of Puerto Rico. But my stay in the Boquemar Inn was unpleasant. First, the employee that manage my registration at the front desk was unprofesional. She looked like she was never happy with what she was doing. Second, the access ramp to the third floor looked like a labyrinth. Third, it seemed like somebody emptied a truck of ice on the pool. It was extremely cold. The air conditioning lack of conditioning was obvious, better said, the maintenance was lacking, since it did not chill. And finally the noise of the nearby pubs was unbearable and kept me awake at night.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In general, our experience was unpleasant. First, when me and my girlfriend called to make reservations, the employee, conveniently, forgot to tell us that there was a bikers convention that weekend at the hotel facilities. For obvious reasons, this is the kind of information that we expect to know before making a reservation, counting on the good faith of the hotel personel of course, specially if one object the roaring sound of a whole bunch of motorcycles just outside the hotel and the presence of leather wearing gang impersonators everywhere. Second, the lady employee at the front desk was indiferent, unfriendly and kind of rude, constantly asking for a confirmation number, even thou we explain that we do not have it with us at the moment. At that moment, we asked ourselves, is it so hard to look in the reservation records for our reservation, as she finally did?...In my opinion, there is little or no supervision of the front desk employees. Third, there was no hot water!...Can you believe it?...When we called the front desk to inform this problem, at 7:00 PM, the employee told us that the hotel was near full capacity and apparently, every guest was showering at the same time. In our frustation, we joked that maybe the bikers were washing their bikes all at once. Fifth, the location of the hotel allows all kind of loud music and noise from local pubs and bars in to the room even thou the room is air conditioned. This may be a good thing for a party looking guest, but not for the typical, rest and quiet looking person that visit the west coast of the island. Sixth, the pool area was unkept and the water was foul. And last, but not least, the fact that the administration stamped a piece of paper on the back of the doors of each room, explaining, for example, that if you steal a towel you will be billed $10.00 or if you steal the TV you will be billed $300.00 is a very rude and cheaply attitude. They should know that not all guests are thieves and robers. I can not comment about the restaurant because we decided to eat elsewhere, not wanting another bad experience. Finally, the hotel is too expensive for the value they offer. I have being experiencing the hospitality of the west coast of Puerto Rico for decades, specially the hotels in the bahia salinas area, and in my opinion, the boquemar experience was the low point.

Reviews.Title: “there must be something better”
Reviews.Author: SZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed in hotels/inns throughout Puerto Rico in this price range and all were superior to this parador. The room was equipped but the staff could only be described as indifferent and there was a general drabness to the place. I must say that the location was perfect, in town and a 15 minute walk to the beach. We never even considered their restaurant since it was so dark and there are many cheerful, interesting places to eat in town.

Reviews.Title: “Too basic for me, and the restaurant always runs out of fresh vegetables”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a crabby experience at this Parador. There is no elevator, but there is a ramp to the third floor which is very much like a ski slope in Austria. I was panting by the time I reached our room and the young men at the desk offered no help. The ramp is supposed to make the hotel accessible to people in wheelchairs, but it would take Arnold Swartzenneger to push a chair up that incline! We had dinner in the restaurant which has a Gastronomic designation from the Puerto Rico Tourism authority. That has to be a mistake. I was looking forward to Caribbean lobster, but all they had was frozen lobster from Africa which was done up in a cream sauce and quite good but, there was no lettuce for a salad, and no fresh vegetables. A large supermarket was nearby, and I wondered why someone just didn't go shopping and get fresh food. Breakfast was fine with a delicious and large serving of fresh papaya with eggs, bacon, ham or sausage and juice for $4.25. Boqueron is colorful. There are numerous small stands selling oysters and clams, but they are not refrigerated and I didn't dare eat shellfish that had been sitting in 80 degree weather for hours. Some of the vendors are very surly. When I asked the price of a small leather purse, the woman behind the stand barked out "Five dollars!" I did not buy the purse, and in fact we got out of there as soon as possible. We drove about two hours to Rincon and very thankfully checked into the delightful Villa Cofresi.
